page.title: 18Memories of Wakefield
page.content: Fifty years ago,girls attending the{ {Girl's High School}wore similar uniforms as today i.e.skirts,blouses and dresses.For P.E.however they wore luminous shorts .For entertainment in Wakefield 50 years ago children could go to the pictures or theatre which were far more popular then.Many teenagers joined youth clubs .At home people would listen to the radio which was called the wireless.The Second World War did not affect the children of Wakefield very much,as it was the nearby City of Sheffield which took most of the German bombs.People did have to get used to using coupons for clothes,sweets and food.All children had to carry gas masks but they were never used.Public transport in Wakefield was said to be better forty years ago than it is now,at least buses came on time,every ten minutes.
